bibliographic-data.invention-title: Plasma reactor and process for producing lower-energy hydrogen species

document-id.name: GILLIGAN III THOMAS J, et al
GILLIGAN III THOMAS J, et al
SHEPARD JR VANCE R [US], et al
SHEPARD JR VANCE R [US], et al
MUTTERER JR JAMES NELSON [US], et al
MUTTERER JR JAMES NELSON [US], et al

abstract.p: This invention relates to a reactor to generate power, plasma, light, and novel hydrogen compounds by the catalysis of atomic hydrogen. The power balance is optimized by maximizing the output power from the hydrogen catalysis reaction while minimizing the input power by controlling the parameters of the input power to initiate or at least partially maintain the plasma such as the power density, pulse frequency, duty cycle, and peak and offset electric fields.
